result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Lawade Baskin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With full huber.  Concurrent with 21CM179 and 22CM413. 
Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by October 3, 2022 for report date within 60 days or no later than November 27, 2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont Lawade Baskin

records.addlTxt: 11:24 AM Defendant Lamont Lawade Baskin in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Lamont Lawade Baskin.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Court orders 10 months Rock County Jail with full huber, stayed with diversion, call by October 3, 2022 and report by November 27, 2022, concurrent with 21CM179 and 22CM413, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.
